title.narrative: Food Security Program with Anchor of Hope Charities - Zambia - 2017

description.narrative:
Anchor of Hope Charities was established in 2007 to implement health and education programs for underprivileged and orphaned children with a vision to provide them K-12 education through a holistic approach to meet their basic needs.
They have focused their efforts in Zambia, Africa. Zambia is home to a population of 15.7 million people, with half being children under the age of 15. They are currently serving 45,000 children.
In addition to directly delivering education instruction, their approach addresses the basic needs of these children such as clean water, sanitation, food, clothing and healthcare. This strategy provides these children with better nutrition and better health thus reducing childhood illness and school absenteeism and greatly improving the chances of them successfully completing their education curriculum. Anchor of Hope Charities believes that through completing their education the children can break out of the cycle of poverty and constructively contribute to the betterment of their community.
Stop Hunger now provides this program with 1 container of food assistance
